channel.title: My Old Kentucky Blog
channel.description: a music blog that parties with unicorns

item.title: Song : Tempers : “Strange Harvest”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: This past Valentine’s Day, we highlighted the Eyes Wide Wider Digital 7″ from New York gothgaze act Tempers. To follow that up, the duo will be releasing another digital 7″ via Pendu Sound, this one named Strange Harvest, on April 24. Listen to the volatile “Strange Harvest” below and look for purchase details [...]
item.content:encoded: This past Valentine’s Day, we highlighted the Eyes Wide Wider Digital 7″ from New York gothgaze act Tempers. To follow that up, the duo will be releasing another digital 7″ via Pendu Sound, this one named Strange Harvest, on April 24. Listen to the volatile “Strange Harvest” below and look for purchase details here.

item.title: Song : Superhumanoids : “So Strange”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: It has been a bit since we heard some new material from LA’s Superhumanoids. They last caught our attention with the wonderful pop song “Geri” early last year. The band is getting ready to release their debut album, Exhibitionists, on June 11th via Innovative Leisure. To give everyone a taste of what [...]
item.content:encoded: It has been a bit since we heard some new material from LA’s Superhumanoids. They last caught our attention with the wonderful pop song “Geri” early last year. The band is getting ready to release their debut album, Exhibitionists, on June 11th via Innovative Leisure. To give everyone a taste of what is to come, they have revealed their first song, “So Strange,” from the LP. The song is another breezy slice of pop that goes down quite nicely. Listen below.

item.title: Song : Prides : “Out Of The Blue”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Glasgow, Scotland has been very good to music lovers in recent years with the likes of Frightened Rabbit, The Twilight Sad, We Were Promised Jetpacks, and CHVRCHES to name a few. We just might be adding another name to that list with the trio known as Prides, if their song “Out of The Blue” [...]
item.content:encoded: Glasgow, Scotland has been very good to music lovers in recent years with the likes of Frightened Rabbit, The Twilight Sad, We Were Promised Jetpacks, and CHVRCHES to name a few. We just might be adding another name to that list with the trio known as Prides, if their song “Out of The Blue” is any indication. There is not a lot out there in regards to the band other than they use to be known as Midnight Lion. After a name change, they caught the attention of the previously mentioned CHVRCHES, who touted the band and the single via their social media. The song is a wave of dark, emotionally charged synthpop. Listen below.

item.title: Video : NONONO : “Pumpin Blood”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Swedish pop trio NONONO delivered the goods a little over a week back with their infectious song “Pumpin Blood,” now we get the video for the cut. Directed by Magnus Härdner, this one shows a man have a rough day only to turn it around after realizing that just being alive is enough. [...]
item.content:encoded: Swedish pop trio NONONO delivered the goods a little over a week back with their infectious song “Pumpin Blood,” now we get the video for the cut. Directed by Magnus Härdner, this one shows a man have a rough day only to turn it around after realizing that just being alive is enough. Of course, dancing ensues. The band makes appearances throughout. Watch below.

item.title: Song : Foals : “Late Night” (Koreless Remix)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: UK producer Koreless worked a little magic on Foals song “Late Night” from their most recent LP, Holy Fire. It takes the song to a hypnotic underwater world of magic that is best experienced with headphones one. Check it out below and compare it to the original. For those in and around Indianapolis, MOKB [...]
item.content:encoded:
UK producer Koreless worked a little magic on Foals song “Late Night” from their most recent LP, Holy Fire. It takes the song to a hypnotic underwater world of magic that is best experienced with headphones one. Check it out below and compare it to the original.

For those in and around Indianapolis, MOKB Presents will be bringing Foals along with Surfer Blood to the Old National Centre on May 17th. You can find the full details here.

item.title: Song : London Grammar : “Wasting My Young Years”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Wow! That is all we can say. I am not sure if London Grammar are capable of anything less than perfection. The group previously released the excellent songs “Hey Now” and “Metal & Dust,” now we get the ballad titled “Wasting My Young Years” that pulls at your heart strings. The [...]
item.content:encoded: Wow! That is all we can say. I am not sure if London Grammar are capable of anything less than perfection. The group previously released the excellent songs “Hey Now” and “Metal & Dust,” now we get the ballad titled “Wasting My Young Years” that pulls at your heart strings. The song further confirms the fact this act is fully worthy of a next big thing label. They just have that “it” factor. Listen below.

item.title: MOKB Video Premiere : Atlas Genius : “Trojans”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: It has been a big last few months for Aussie band Atlas Genius. The trio scored a hit with their infectious song “Trojans” and their debut album, When It Was Now, has been holding steady on the charts since its release this past February. For their latest endeavor, the band teamed up with [...]
item.content:encoded:
It has been a big last few months for Aussie band Atlas Genius. The trio scored a hit with their infectious song “Trojans” and their debut album, When It Was Now, has been holding steady on the charts since its release this past February. For their latest endeavor, the band teamed up with four of Vimeo’s top creators have each of them produce a original video for the previously mentioned “Trojans.”

“As an artist, you are always interested in how your audience interprets a song you wrote and in this instance we were able to dip into Vimeo’s talent to create four amazingly different interpretations of “Trojans,” the band stated in a recent interview with Mashable.

Below, you will find the visual directed by Eric Funk, an animator in the Vimeo community. In the clip, Funk uses a simple cardboard canvas with different imagery being splashed across to follow along with the song. The band, who has been out on the road with Silversun Pickups, will be on their first headlining tour this summer, so be on the look out for the band in a city near you.

Atlas Genius – Trojans from Eric Funk on Vimeo.

item.title: My Old Kentucky Blog Session : JJ Grey : Live at Sun King Brewery
item.dc:creator: Dodge
item.description: This past December, Jacksonville-based singer/songwriter JJ Grey stopped by the Sun King Brewery in Indianapolis to spend some time with our friends and MyOldKentuckyBlog.com. We recorded some new cuts from his new album, This River, which is being released today through Alligator Records. This River is JJ’s seventh album and his first studio album [...]
item.content:encoded:
This past December, Jacksonville-based singer/songwriter JJ Grey stopped by the Sun King Brewery in Indianapolis to spend some time with our friends and MyOldKentuckyBlog.com. We recorded some new cuts from his new album, This River, which is being released today through Alligator Records. This River is JJ’s seventh album and his first studio album since 2010’s Georgia Warhorse. This River, like JJ’s previous releases, was produced by Grey and Dan Prothero, and recorded at Retrophonics Studio in Saint Augustine, Florida.

JJ continues his tour throughout April and May, and recently made a stop in Bloomington, IN. Remaining tour dates below.

JJ Grey – 99 Shades of Crazy (Live at Sun King Brewery)

JJ Grey – This River (Live at Sun King Brewery)

JJ Grey – Tame A Wild One (Live at Sun King Brewery)

JJ Grey Tour Dates:

item.content:encoded:

item.title: MOKB Premiere : Suburban Living : “Video Love”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Last year, Norfolk, VA’s Wesley Bunch, aka Suburban Living, released the excellent Cooper’s Dream EP drenched in its nostalgia and heavy reverb. Today, he is following-up that release with the Always Eyes 7″ via Dialog Records. On the 7″, we get more of that reverb and sound that will draw your mind to [...]
item.content:encoded:
Last year, Norfolk, VA’s Wesley Bunch, aka Suburban Living, released the excellent Cooper’s Dream EP drenched in its nostalgia and heavy reverb. Today, he is following-up that release with the Always Eyes 7″ via Dialog Records. On the 7″, we get more of that reverb and sound that will draw your mind to times past. Last month, we heard the a-side “Always Eyes”, now listen and download the just as engaging, shimmering b-side “Video Love” below.

Previous:
